trans-unit.source: When you no longer need a data disk that's attached to a virtual machine, you can easily detach it.
trans-unit.target: When you no longer need a data disk that's attached to a virtual machine, you can easily detach it.

trans-unit.source: This removes the disk from the virtual machine, but doesn't remove it from storage.
trans-unit.target: This removes the disk from the virtual machine, but doesn't remove it from storage.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the existing data on the disk again, you can reattach it to the same virtual machine, or another one.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the existing data on the disk again, you can reattach it to the same virtual machine, or another one.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A virtual machine in Azure uses different types of disks -- an operating system disk, a local temporary disk, and optional data disks.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A virtual machine in Azure uses different types of disks -- an operating system disk, a local temporary disk, and optional data disks.

trans-unit.source: Data disks are the recommended way to store data for a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Data disks are the recommended way to store data for a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [About Disks and VHDs for Virtual Machines](../../virtual-machines-disks-vhds.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [About Disks and VHDs for Virtual Machines](../../virtual-machines-disks-vhds.md).

trans-unit.source: It's not possible to detach an operating system disk unless you also delete the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: It's not possible to detach an operating system disk unless you also delete the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Find the disk
trans-unit.target: Find the disk

trans-unit.source: If you don't know the name of the disk or want to verify it before you detach it, follow these steps.
trans-unit.target: If you don't know the name of the disk or want to verify it before you detach it, follow these steps.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure automatically assigns a name to the disk when you attach it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure automatically assigns a name to the disk when you attach it.

trans-unit.source: The name consists of the cloud service name, the virtual machine name, and a number.
trans-unit.target: The name consists of the cloud service name, the virtual machine name, and a number.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the [Azure Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the [Azure Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of virtual machine, and then click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of virtual machine, and then click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Disks**, the table lists the name and type of all attached disks.
trans-unit.target: Under **Disks**, the table lists the name and type of all attached disks.

trans-unit.source: Detach the disk
trans-unit.target: Detach the disk

trans-unit.source: After you find the name of the disk, you're ready to detach it:
trans-unit.target: After you find the name of the disk, you're ready to detach it:

trans-unit.source: Click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of the virtual machine that has the data disk you want to detach, and then click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of the virtual machine that has the data disk you want to detach, and then click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: From the command bar, click **Detach Disk**.
trans-unit.target: From the command bar, click **Detach Disk**.

trans-unit.source: Select the data disk, and then click the check mark to detach it.
trans-unit.target: Select the data disk, and then click the check mark to detach it.

trans-unit.source: Detach disk details
trans-unit.target: Detach disk details

trans-unit.source: The disk remains in storage but is no longer attached to a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The disk remains in storage but is no longer attached to a virtual machine.
